Tolkien-related events that took place in 1916.

content.title: Early
content.content: ? - Being a linguist, Tolkien decides to specialise in signalling, and learns Morse code.

content.title: March
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 4.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives his degree at the University of Oxford.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien marries Edith Bratt.

content.title: April
content.content: 29 - William Squire, who would play Gandalf in The Lord of the Rings (1978 film), is born.

content.title: June
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives orders to report in Folkestone, and prepare for embarking.
4 - Tolkien leaves for France.
27 - J.R.R. Tolkien leaves Étaples, and goes to the Somme front.
? - Tolkien might have written the poem Habbanan beneath the Stars.

content.title: July
content.content:
1 - One of the bloodiest battles in recent history, the Battle of the Somme, starts. Robert Gilson is hit by a shell at La Boiselle on the first day; one of the first of the 360,000 British casualties of that battle.
14 - Tolkien's C-company is sent into action at the Somme front.
22 - Ralph "the Baby" Payton, one of the T.C.B.S., is killed in action.

content.title: August
content.content:
12 - Tolkien writes Letter 5.
19 - Tolkien and G.B. Smith meet at Acheux.

content.title: September
content.content:
13-24 - Revises the poem The Mermaid's Flute and composes Consolatrix Afflictorium, and Stella Vespertina
19 - Terence Tiller, writer of the 1955 radio series of The Lord of the Rings, is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
26 - While in reserve, J.R.R. Tolkien's battalion is inspected by Sir Doulgas Haig, the British commander at the Battle of the Somme.
27 - Tolkien is struck by "pyrexia of unknown origin": trench fever.

content.title: November
content.content:
8 - Tolkien is repatriated, and is sent to a hospital in Birmingham.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien signs a form for the War Office, confirming his return to England from France due to trench fever.
29 - G.B. Smith is hit by shrapnel, and wounded on his right arm and thigh.

content.title: December
content.content:
3 - G.B. Smith dies of gas-gangrene in his wounds. The news doesn't reach Tolkien until the 16th.
16-25 - Tolkien recovers, and he and Edith visit Great Haywood.
28 - Noel Johnson, who would play Éomer in The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series), is born.

? Canon Norman Power, an acquaintance of J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
